row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: To trust my inner knowingness and take action accordingly… in personal and professional actions.
sentences.chinese: 信任內在的覺知，要身體力行，並且是專業化的行動。

sentences.english: You see, before he died, Bentham addressed himself to a question consistent with his philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 在他死之前，邊沁身體力行了他自己的哲學。

sentences.english: July 31What your body is doing is a reflection of what your life is about.
sentences.chinese: 你身體力行的反映出你此生的成就。

sentences.english: She didn't always practise what she preached.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有身體力行她承諾的事情。

sentences.english: Clear responsibility for your own positions, do not shirk, do not escape.
sentences.chinese: 明確自身的崗位責任並身體力行，不推卸，不逃避。

sentences.english: How can we make sense of rational behavior which didn't do that?
sentences.chinese: 如果我們沒有身體力行，又如何說得通理性的行爲呢？

sentences.english: Preachers can talk but never teach, Unless they practise what they preach.
sentences.chinese: 說教的人不身體力行，就只能空談，不能起教育作用。

sentences.english: As a leader, you must exemplify the culture and its values.
sentences.chinese: 作爲領導，你必須身體力行你的公司文化及其價值觀。

sentences.english: Taking responsibility takes practice and opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 學習如何負擔責任需要你的孩子身體力行和掌握機會。

definition: to repay a favor/to give back/feedback
to spare no pains or effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to offer respectfully/to consecrate/to dedicate/to devote

to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
